case_theme: 2. Exploring the Future Without a Change in the Other
background: Jack seeks to understand how to be perceived as cooperative by Mr. Simon.
pre_reasoning: Exploring future scenarios without relying on changes in others is a key aspect of Solution-Focused Brief Therapy.

dialog.text: So what do you have to do to be “cooperative” in Mr. Simon’s eyes?
dialog.observation: Therapist prompts Jack to consider actions that would be perceived as cooperative.

dialog.text: I guess he would say that I would not be screwing around when his back is turned.
dialog.observation: Jack reflects on a behavior that may be perceived negatively by Mr. Simon.

dialog.text: So, you would not be doing that. What would you be doing instead?
dialog.reference_labels: [Eliciting a positive representation for a well-defined goal instead of the negation]
dialog.reasoning: Therapist guides Jack to envision positive behaviors as an alternative.

dialog.text: I guess I would be doing my work or at least keeping my mouth shut.
dialog.observation: Jack considers engaging in productive tasks or maintaining restraint as cooperative actions.

post_reasoning: Exploring future behaviors and actions that align with the desired perception of cooperation is a central focus of Solution-Focused Brief Therapy.
